Youre splitting hairs here in an unreasonable way, beyond the fact that riots sub classes are changed so often and theres enough overlap to make distinctions like "warden", "catcher", and "vanguard" worthless you completely ignore the fact that archetypes exist. 

Do you understand what a burst caster is? Im using _very specific_ terms here - burst and caster - to describe to the fullest of my ability a specific kind of champion. 
Burst meaning "high damage in a rotation" and caster meaning "from abilities" as chubbyemu (a great youtube channel. Check him out! League unrelated.) would say.

Assassin is a less than explicit term referring to any champion with hyper mobility who possesses burst damage. 
Hyper mobility is defined as the ability to get _in and out_ of a fight on the same or multiple abilities.
"Assassin builds" are builds which divers are capable of that allow champions in the diver pool (example; Camille, Aatrox, Vi, gragas, nocturne) to perform the _burst_ aspect of an assassin despite their lack of hyper mobility. 

With riots overlapping champion designs and the general vague-ness of their terminology, lets return to Ahri to prove a point. 
Ahri is a hyper mobile champion. Her ultimate is one of the best mobility tools in the game, on a low CD.
Ahri is a burst champion. Her Q, E, W combo is fairly strong and has a low CD.
Ahri is a caster. Most of her damage comes from abilities. 
Ahri is, due to the combination of these three traits, an assassin.
